Tucker_Wetmore:
{{Short description|American country music artist}} {{Infobox musical artist | background = person | name = Tucker Wetmore | image = | image_upright = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1999|11|05}} | birth_place = [[Kalama, Washington]] | origin = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = {{flatlist| * Singer * songwriter }} | instrument = Vocals | discography = | years_active = 2021–present | label = {{flatlist| * Back Blocks * [[Universal Music Group Nashville|UMG Nashville]] }} | website = }} '''Tucker Wetmore''' (born November 5, 1999){{Cite web |date=2024-06-28 |title=Tucker Wetmore Bio, Age, Girlfriend, Net Worth - Ent Radar |url=https://entradar.com/tucker-wetmore/1582/ |access-date=2024-09-04 |language=en-US}} is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter.{{cite web |last1=Hollabaugh |first1=Leslie |title=Tucker Wetmore Signs With Back Blocks Music |url=https://musicrow.com/2023/01/tucker-wetmore-signs-with-back-blocks-music/ |website=MusicRow |access-date=6 March 2024}} ==Early life and education== Wetmore was raised in [[Kalama, Washington]] and graduated from [[Kalama Middle/High School|Kalama High School]] in 2018.{{cite news |last1=n.a. |title=Pickering, VandenBos, Torgerson sign with Tech |url=https://www.greatfallstribune.com/story/sports/college/2018/01/18/pickering-vandenbos-torgerson-sign-tech/1046988001/ |access-date=6 March 2024 |agency=Great Falls Tribune}} At age 11, he taught himself how to play piano. This was inspired by a love for Jerry Lee Lewis. {{cite news |last1=Leskiw |first1=Jason |title=2B State Football Championship: Quick-study Wetmore Shines in Final Year |url=https://tdn.com/sports/high-school/2b-state-football-championship-quick-study-wetmore-shines-in-final-year/article_5c389e09-86b6-5877-a4a7-46ee9a3f62a3.html |access-date=7 March 2024 |agency=Longview Daily News}} He played football at [[Montana Technological University]], where he majored in business and information technology.{{cite web |last1=n.a. |title=Tucker Wetmore |url=https://godiggers.com/sports/football/roster/tucker-wetmore/2069 |website=Dig City Supply |access-date=6 March 2024}} ==Career== After an injury ended his football career, Wetmore turned to music and relocated to [[Nashville, Tennessee]] in 2020. He released a string of promotional singles in 2021: "Kiss My A$$", "Another Shot", and "She's Trouble".{{cite web |last1=n.a. |title=Tucker Wetmore Issues a Written Warning with His New Single "She's Trouble" |url=https://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/tucker-wetmore-issues-a-written-warning-with-his-new-single-shes-trouble/ |website=The Country Note |access-date=6 March 2024}} In 2023, Wetmore signed with Back Blocks Music, and then later signed an additional partnership with [[Universal Music Group Nashville|UMG Nashville]].{{cite web |last1=Anderson |first1=Liza |title=Tucker Wetmore Signs With UMG Nashville In Partnership With Back Blocks Music |url=https://musicrow.com/2024/05/tucker-wetmore-signs-with-umg-nashville-in-partnership-with-back-blocks-music/ |website=Music Row |access-date=May 31, 2024}} "[[Wine Into Whiskey]]" became his first song to chart on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] and [[Hot Country Songs]] charts in 2024.{{cite web |last1=Zellner |first1=Xander |title=Hot 100 First-Timers: Tucker Wetmore Scores First Chart Hit With 'Wine Into Whiskey' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/tucker-wetmore-hot-100-debut-wine-into-whiskey-1235622294/ |website=Billboard |access-date=6 March 2024}} "[[Wind Up Missin' You]]" was digitally released on March 29, 2024, and was released as Wetmore's country radio debut single on June 10, 2024. ==Discography== ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |+Extended play, with selected details ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:20em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Waves on a Sunset]]'' | * Release date: October 4, 2024 * Label: Back Blocks / [[Universal Music Group Nashville|UMG Nashville]] * Format: Digital download, streaming |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+List of singles, with selected chart positions !
